title: 106_s382
content: The Act may be cited as the "Minuteman Missile National Historic Site Establishment Act of 1999". Congress finds that the Minuteman II ICBM launch control facility and launch facility known as "Delta 1" and "Delta 9" are significant examples of American history during the Cold War. These facilities symbolize the dedication of Air Force missileers stationed in remote locations. The Act aims to preserve and interpret the structures associated with the Minuteman II missile defense system. The Act aims to interpret the historical role of the Minuteman II missile defense system in the context of America's strategic commitment to world peace and the Cold War. It also aims to complement interpretive programs offered by the South Dakota Air and Space Museum. The Minuteman Missile National Historic Site is established under SEC. 3. The Minuteman Missile National Historic Site is established in South Dakota as a unit of the National Park System, consisting of the Minuteman II ICBM launch control facilities. The site map is available for public inspection, and the Secretary of the Interior can make adjustments to the boundary. The Secretary is authorized to make minor adjustments to the boundary of the historic site and administer it in accordance with relevant laws. They shall consult with other agencies and may enter into cooperative agreements for land acquisition. The Secretary may acquire land within the historic site through donation, purchase, exchange, or transfer from another Federal agency, except for contaminated land or South Dakota land which can only be acquired by donation or exchange. The Secretary must prepare a general management plan for the historic site within 3 years of funds availability. The plan includes evaluating locations for a visitor facility and administrative site, modifying the site boundary accordingly, and coordinating functions with Badlands National Park. SEC. 4. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Funds are authorized to be appropriated for carrying out this Act, including transferring Air Force funds for the maintenance of the historic site. The Legacy Resource Management Program funds for resource preservation and treaty compliance are not affected by this Act.
